body: Unfortunately, that would be a breaking change, because there are probably a lot of component packages that expose .sync props and were compiled with vue-loader. So using those packages with a new version of Vue that contains this changer would break those packages - they would emit `update:maxItems`, but your Vue app would listen to `update:max-items`
I agree with @LinusBorg , we should revisit this for v3
I personally find it more consistent to reference all props in camelCase in JavaScript. But as said, this cannot be changed in v2 because it's going to be breaking.

Please do revisit this issue for v3, as I think listening to such camel case events in DOM templates is impossible (as talked about here: https://github.com/vuejs/vue/issues/2669), and I wish I could be more consistent with my components by default:

```pug
    auto-complete(v-model="movie" :text-value.sync="movieText"
    @update:textValue="updateMovies" :item-text="({ title }) => title")
```

I "solved" the problem by implementing a helper function which issues events on both versions:
```javascript
    vue.prototype.$emitCase = function (name, ...args) {
      const camelCaseName = name.toLowerCase().replace(/-(.)/g,
        (_, g) => g.toUpperCase())
      this.$emit(name, ...args)
      this.$emit(camelCaseName, ...args)
    }
```

Edit: It seems like Vue 2.3+ has introduced `.camel`, which "solves" the DOM issue. But I still think we should aim for more consistency.

You definitely should add a note about that in the documentation. Today I spent half an hour trying to figure out why my `.sync` doesn't work.

The problem is that the documentation on [Custom Events: Event Names](https://vuejs.org/v2/guide/components-custom-events.html#Event-Names) states:

> For these reasons, we recommend you always use kebab-case for event names.

So it's not always: more like always unless you emit event for `.sync`. You should add a note about that.

Also in the documentation [Custom Events: `.sync` modifier](https://vuejs.org/v2/guide/components-custom-events.html#sync-Modifier) I would change the example to use a property with multiple word name (now it's a single word `title`, which doesn't help with this problem) and/or add a note about this event name incosistency with previous recommendation ("always use kebab case") on the same page.

Good suggestions to put in an issue in the vuejs.org repository. 

Here they will go unnoticed, the issue is old and closed.

issue.title: Adds handler for kebab-case event for v-bind:sync; fix #6428

repository.name: vue
repository.description: This is the repo for Vue 2. For Vue 3, go to https://github.com/vuejs/core

-->

- [x] No

If yes, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications:

**The PR fulfills these requirements:**

- [x] It's submitted to the `dev` branch for v2.x (or to a previous version branch), _not_ the `master` branch
- [x] When resolving a specific issue, it's referenced in the PR's title (e.g. `fix #xxx[,#xxx]`, where "xxx" is the issue number)
- [x] All tests are passing: https://github.com/vuejs/vue/blob/dev/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#development-setup
- [x] New/updated tests are included

**Other information:**

Addresses #6428 and https://github.com/vuejs/vuejs.org/issues/1648

issue.title: Wrong documentation for .sync modifier
issue.body:
There is an error in the vue.js documentation for the .sync modifier you can find here: 
https://vuejs.org/v2/guide/components-custom-events.html#sync-Modifier

It states, that you should use a kebab-case event name for the .sync event:

> Thatâ€™s why instead, we recommend emitting events in the pattern of `update:my-prop-name.` `

This is not correct. because the event must be camelCased to work properly.

issue.title: Autocomplete search input event cannot be bound using an HTML attribute

labels.name: wontfix
labels.description: The issue is expected and will not be fixed

labels.name: upstream
labels.description: Problem with a third party library that we may have to work around

issue.body:
<!--
Before submitting an issue:
  Search the repo and ensure your issue doesn't already exist. If so, it may:
    - Have already been fixed in an unreleased version.
    - Have been closed without a solution. Please create a new issue instead of commenting on the old one.
  Create a minimal reproduction to illustrate the issue.
    Do not include any more than is needed to reproduce the bug
    Here's a CodePen template to start you off: https://template.vuetifyjs.com

You may remove sections if they aren't relevant, but please supply as much information as possible. Incomplete issues will be closed.
-->

<!-- not from package.json, use console.log(Vuetify.version) -->
### Versions and Environment
Vuetify: 1.1.1
Vue: 2.5.16
Browsers: Chrome 68.0.3440.106
OS: Mac OS 10.13.6

### Steps to reproduce
<!-- What should we do to your link to make the bug happen? -->
Attempt to register an HTML bound event handler with `<v-autocomplete>` search update event

### Expected Behavior
<!-- What did you expect to happen? -->
Expect to be able to register an event handler

### Actual Behavior
<!-- What actually happened? -->
No event handler may be registered using an HTML attribute due to the [camel case event name](https://github.com/vuetifyjs/vuetify/blob/dev/src/components/VAutocomplete/VAutocomplete.js#L99)

### Reproduction Link
<!-- Required, see above for information -->

See this [codepen](https://codepen.io/dkichler/pen/BOdMJq) demonstrating the issue.

issue.title: feat(VSelect): emit selected listIndex event
